ARABIC: قَالُوا۟ لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَسْـَٔلِ ٱلْعَآدِّينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will say, 'We tarried there for a day or part of a day. Ask those able to count!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will say: "A day or less than a day. Ask the enumerators of numbers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They will say: "We stayed for a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count of this."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will reply. "We remained for about a day or part of it, but ask those who have kept count".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They will say, “We stayed a day or part of a day, so ask those who keep count.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep account."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They will say: We tarried a day or part of a day, but ask those who keep account.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They shall say, 'We have tarried a day, or part of a day; ask the numberers!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They will say: We tarried by a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep count!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They will say, "We stayed a day or part of a day. Ask those who have kept count."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: -They will say we tarried a day or part of a day; ask those who keep count.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will say, ‘We remained for a day, or part of a day; yet ask those who keep the count.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day: but ask those who keep account."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will say: "We stayed a day or part of a day. Ask of those who keep account."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They will reply: 'A day, or part of a day; ask those who have kept count'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will say, “We remained a day, or part of a day; but ask those who keep count.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:113] They will say, ‘We tarried a day, or part of a day — they are uncertain thereof, deeming it shorter [than what it was] because of the gravity of the chastisement they are suffering. Yet ask those who keep count!’, namely, [ask] the angels who number the deeds of [all] creatures.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They will say: We tarried but a day) upon saying this, they will have some doubt, and therefore will say: (or part of a day). Then, they said: we do not know: (Ask of those who keep count!) i.e. the angels who record people's deeds; it is also said that this refers to the angel of death and his helpers.
